title: Please need help with this lagg
body:
I cant stand this lag anymore and it doesn't make sense. My Ping is constantly at 34, and my FPS is always at 300. I also did a pocket loss analysis and it said it was 0% loss. I do not know what could be wrong. Can someone help please?   These are my computer specs:

System: Alienware Aurora-R4 Windows 10 home 64-bit
Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-3820 CPU @3.6GHz (8 CPUs), ~3.6 GHz
memory: 8192MB RAM (3781 MB used)
DirectX Version: 12
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970

replies.body: The lagg came back today even stronger eventhough I'm playing with the Firewall off, should I just send in a ticket? Also I noticed there's only lag when moving, not when using skills. When buying stuff I cant buy with double cliking, I can only buy when I press the buy icon in shop.
The only problem is I cant find league of legends under add a program to the firewall exception lol...
I'm confused lol Why does having trouble at 300 ping affect my constant 35 ping games?

Your games aren't consistently 35 ping, though, regardless of what you're seeing.  Something within your home network is unstable and causing huge ping spikes, and this struggling network  is trying to communicate with the game server for the entirety of the match.  It is not a fun time!

Thanks for the info here!  It looks like your local connection at home is having a really tough time, at +300 ping.  I know you've done some troubleshooting already which is great, I also recommend running through the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to tune up your home network.  It's important to go over each step to rule out possibilities.  Let me know if you have any questions!
Im not sure what you mean by take out the first two hops, but the results show 0% loss.

Update: thank you for replying. I'm currently running it. I also ran the hex-tech fix tool, and even synced clock and re downloaded the game and nothing. I don't know if this helpful information but it seems MOBAs tend to lag on this PC while other games are just fine.

P.S i'm connected directly to the internet via Ethernet.

This is a really strange case, because it does sound like packet loss.  If the logreader didn't show any issues, run a traceroute with [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to see if there might be a routing issue.  Route it to the NA game server 104.160.131.1 for about 5 minutes.  Take out the IP for your first two hops, and let me know the results.
